# Copilot Project Instructions

Whenever you answer a question, always use the documentation files under the `docs/` folder as a reference. Prioritize information from the project's `readme.md` to ensure responses are accurate and aligned with project-specific details and guidelines.

## Project Overview
- **Project Name:** Stencil
- **Main Purpose:** A compiler for generating Web Components using TypeScript and JSX, built by the Ionic team.
- **Key Technologies:** Stencil, TypeScript, Node.js

## Key Concepts & Terminology
- **Stencil:** A tool for building reusable web components. Stencil components look similar to class-based React components, with TypeScript decorators and ShadowDOM support.
- **Compiler:** Generates web components from TypeScript/JSX source code.
- **Runtime:** Executes and manages web components in the browser.
- **CLI:** Command Line Interface for interacting with the project, entry point at `bin/stencil`.

## Important Files & Folders
- `src/` - Source code
- `docs/` - Documentation (see `docs/compiler.md`, `docs/runtime.md`, etc.)
- `bin/stencil` - CLI entry point
- `scripts/` - Build and release scripts
- `readme.md` - Main project overview and usage instructions

## Contribution Guidelines
- See [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/stenciljs/core/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for contribution rules.
- **When generating a commit message, always follow the commit message format and rules described in CONTRIBUTING.md.**
- Technical documentation for contributors is in the `docs/` directory.
- All contributors must follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/stenciljs/core/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
